page.title: 11Changes in Bredon.
page.content: Until the second world war,Bredon was confined between the church and the railway line.There were many small cottages such as{Magpie Row,Jackdaw {Terrace}and the cottages near the railway line.The{Alms houses}were founded by{Katherine Reed}in 1696 which were 8 small cottages but gradually reduced to 6.There were quite a few large houses including Bredon House,The Old Mansion,The Manor,The Rectory,The Cider House, Wellington Lodge.In the 1950's 80 council houses were built and the estate was called{Queensmead}.Later in the 1960's{St Giles Road,Brasenose Rd. and{College Rd.}were built,adding 70 houses.10 years later 16 houses were constructed called{Waterloo Way. These few houses grew and became {Wellington Gardens.}In the end there were 260 houses on this estate.
